resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

praveenbingo commented on pull request #4474: ARROW-5485:[Crossbow] GTest shared library not loaded correctly.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4474
 
 
   - Turning off tests for OSX since GTest shared is not loaded correctly.
   
   Successful builds 
   - https://travis-ci.org/praveenbingo/arrow-build/builds/541210292

wesm commented on issue #4474: ARROW-5485: [Crossbow] GTest shared library not loaded correctly.
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4474#issuecomment-499650493
 
 
   @praveenbingo can you post a link to the error you encountered? This is certainly caused by https://github.com/apache/arrow/commit/c39db9977dea5dec60650ee71b2d07d464ded682#diff-17332cbb6d1162a7c9441b9f53cca413. We need to ensure that gtest output libgtest.so into the main build output directory so the unit test executables find it

wesm commented on pull request #4493: ARROW-5485: [C++] Install libraries from googletest_ep into build output directory on non-Windows platforms
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4493
 
 
   I missed this when working on the googletest shared library migration as it only is a problem on macOS. Linux uses the library path from the link step without any extra fiddling, but on macOS it cannot resolve the library as described on the ARROW-5485 ticket.
   
   This change results in the shared libraries being installed adjacent to the build outputs, e.g.
   
   ```
   $ ll release/
   total 20180
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm  4492248 Jun  6 16:59 arrow-array-test*
   lrwxrwxrwx 1 wesm wesm       14 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow.so -> libarrow.so.14*
   lrwxrwxrwx 1 wesm wesm       18 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow.so.14 -> libarrow.so.14.0.0*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm 14900504 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow.so.14.0.0*
   lrwxrwxrwx 1 wesm wesm       22 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow_testing.so -> libarrow_testing.so.14*
   lrwxrwxrwx 1 wesm wesm       26 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow_testing.so.14 -> libarrow_testing.so.14.0.0*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm   583048 Jun  6 16:58 libarrow_testing.so.14.0.0*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm    16552 Jun  6 16:58 libgmock_main.so*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm   174824 Jun  6 16:58 libgmock.so*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm    16456 Jun  6 16:58 libgtest_main.so*
   -rwxr-xr-x 1 wesm wesm   464352 Jun  6 16:58 libgtest.so*
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

praveenbingo commented on issue #4493: ARROW-5485: [C++] Install libraries from googletest_ep into build output directory on non-Windows platforms
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4493#issuecomment-499770160
 
 
   @wesm - It fails in my desktop post this change. I think its because the linked through rpath
   
   otool -L on any test gives the following output
   
   	@rpath/libarrow_testing.14.dylib (compatibility version 14.0.0, current version 14.0.0)
   	@rpath/libarrow.14.dylib (compatibility version 14.0.0, current version 14.0.0)
   	libgtest_main.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	libgtest.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	libgmock.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
   	/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 400.9.4)
   	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1252.250.1)
   
   running the test from build folder still gives 
   
   dyld: Library not loaded: libgtest_main.dylib
     Referenced from: /Users/praveenkumar/Desktop/dremio/code/arrow-for/arrow/cpp/build/./release/arrow-array-test
     Reason: image not found
   
   however, cd into release folder and running the test works.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

   @wesm - It fails in my desktop post this change. I think its because gtest is not linked using rpath. 
   
   otool -L on any test gives the following output
   
   	@rpath/libarrow_testing.14.dylib (compatibility version 14.0.0, current version 14.0.0)
   	@rpath/libarrow.14.dylib (compatibility version 14.0.0, current version 14.0.0)

   	/usr/lib/libc++.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 400.9.4)
   	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1252.250.1)
   
   running the test from build folder still gives 
   
   dyld: Library not loaded: libgtest_main.dylib
     Referenced from: /Users/praveenkumar/Desktop/dremio/code/arrow-for/arrow/cpp/build/./release/arrow-array-test
     Reason: image not found
   
   however, cd into release folder and running the test works.

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description: OSX builds are failing for the last 3 days.

comments.body:
[~wesmckinn] I think this started when we switched to using shared gtest library.

We get the following error : (happens both locally and in travis when building gtest from source)

dyld: Library not loaded: libgtest_main.dylib
 Referenced from: /Users/travis/build/[secure]/arrow-build/arrow/cpp/build/./release/gandiva-decimal_test
 Reason: image not found
dev/tasks/gandiva-jars/build-cpp-osx.sh: line 45:  5626 Abort trap: 6

All tests failed with this error.

Maybe the rpath for the source code build library is not being set correctly? I ran it with the cmake rpath flag to on but it did not help.

I am planning to turn tests off in OsX Crossbow if this is not a quick fix.
[~wesmckinn] - any pointers will be highly appreciated and useful :)
